014
015package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer;
016
017import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
018import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
019import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
020import java.lang.annotation.Target;
021import java.util.List;
022
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
024import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal.DefineListFactory;
025
026/**
027 * Defines a named attribute as a comma-separated {@link String} from the
028 * elements of the annotated array or {@link List} argument. Attributes are
029 * stored on the {@link StatementContext}, and may be used by the template
030 * engine. For example:
031 *
032 * <pre>
033 * &#64;SqlUpdate("insert into &lt;table&gt; (&lt;columns&gt;) values (&lt;values&gt;)")
034 * int insert(@Define String table, @DefineList List&lt;String&gt; columns, @BindList List&lt;Object&gt; values);
035 *
036 * &#64;SqlQuery("select &lt;columns&gt; from &lt;table&gt; where id = :id")
037 * ResultSet select(@DefineList("columns") List&lt;String&gt; columns, @Define("table") String table, @Bind("id") long id);
038 * </pre>
039 *
040 * <p>
041 * An array or {@code List} argument passed to {@code @DefineList} will be
042 * converted to a comma-separated String and set as a whole as a single
043 * specified attribute. Duplicate members in the {@code List} may cause SQL
044 * exceptions. An empty {@code List} or {@code null} members in the
045 * {@code List} will result in an {@link IllegalArgumentException}.
046 * </p>
047 *
048 * <p>
049 * Be aware of the list members you're binding with @DefineList, as there is no
050 * input sanitization! <b>Blindly passing Strings through
051 * <code>@DefineList</code> may make your application vulnerable to SQL
052 * Injection.</b>
053 * </p>
054 *
055 * @see Define
056 */
057@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
058@Target(ElementType.PARAMETER)
059@SqlStatementCustomizingAnnotation(DefineListFactory.class)
060public @interface DefineList {
061    /**
062     * The attribute name to define. If omitted, the name of the annotated
063     * parameter is used. It is an error to omit the name when there is no
064     * parameter naming information in your class files.
065     *
066     * @return the attribute key
067     */
068    String value() default "";
069}
